description.narrative:
1. Strengthening and enhancing the research capacities of CLACSO institutional network in priority fields of social sciences and humanities, increasing the opportunities for the development of high-quality academic production, by means of peers evaluation processes.
2. Contributing to develop institutional synergies that encourage the tasks of quality and relevance social research that different universities conduct and think tanks in Latin America and the Caribbean.
3. Promoting programs of applied research that allow knowledge production to processes of democratic social innovation in line with the challenges that open in the region to fulfill the Sustainable Development Objectives and to the 2030 Agenda.
4. Enhancing the research opportunities and the creation of scientific communities in those Latin American and Caribbean countries where social sciences and humanities had less relative development.
5. Promoting institutional strategies that contribute to the building of bridges between social research and public policies oriented towards democratic social innovation.

Det regionala latinamerikanska och karibiska samhällsvetenskapliga forskningsrådet CLACSO har ansökt om medel från Sida på 30 miljoner kronor för att implementera programmet "Forskning för social och demokratisk innovation" över hela regionen under perioden juli 2018 till juni 2021.
Insatsen syftar till att stärka och främja forskningskapacitet hos CLACSOs institutionella medlemmar - som består av universitetsinstitutioner och tankesmedjor över hela kontinenten - samt att främja att forskningsresultat används i innovationsprocesser för samhällsförändring. Detta sker genom utlysningar för forskningsmedel, stöd till regionala tematiska arbetsgrupper som integrerar forskare och andra sektorer av samhället, samt forskarskolor och kurser för att stärka medlemsinstitutionernas forskarutbildning. Programmet prioriterar särskilt länder i regionen där samhällsvetenskaplig forskning är mindre utvecklad, till exempel Central America, Bolivia, Paraguay och Haiti.
CLACSOs totala budget är för närvarande på omkring 5 miljoner US dollar per år (omkring hälften av detta är motfinansiering från medlemsinstitutionerna), inklusive stödet från Sida. De 30 miljoner kronor som de söker från Sida gäller några av komponenterna i CLACSOs treårsplan juli 2018 - juni 2021, 10 miljoner kronor per år under tre år. Insatsen är ett utfasningsstöd för att underlätta CLACSOs övergång till finansiellt oberoende efter ett mångårigt stöd från Sida.

The regional Latin American and Caribbean social science research council CLACSO has applied for funding from Sida on 30 million SEK to implement the programme "Research for social and democratic innovation" over the whole region during the period July 2018 to June 2021.
The intervention intends to strengthen and promote research capacity within CLACSO's institutional members - consisting of university institutions and think thanks over the whole continent - as well as promote the use of research results in innovation processes for social change. This will be accomplished through open calls for research grants, support to regional thematic working groups integrating researchers and other sectors of society, as well as research training schools and courses in order to strengthen the member institutions' research training. The programme especially prioritizes countries in the region where social science research is less developed, for example Central America, Bolivia, Paraguay and Haiti.
CLACSO's total budget is approximately USD 5 million a year (about half of it contributions in kind from the member institutions), including the Sida support. The SEK 30 million applied from Sida will cover some of the components in the three years plan July 2018 - June 2021, SEK 10 million a year during three years. The intervention is a phasing-out support to facilitate CLACSO's transition to financial independence after many years of Sida support.

description.narrative:
The "Observatory Thinking the Pandemic" was amplified with different kinds of analyses from the perspectives of public health, humanities and social sciences.
The CLACSO working groups mainained a high level of production and the cooperation and exchange between the CLACSO institutional members (university institutions and think-thanks) increased.
New publications and an increase in open access publications and visits at the CLACSO virtual library. Among the most downloaded books during the first semester 2021 published by CLACSO regional working groups (published in the Spanish language, titles translated to English by Sida):
Religion in front of the social problems. Spirituality, power, and sociability in Latin America. (Ed. Verónica Gimenez Beliveau) 108 130 downloads.
The media. At the service of whom? (Jesús González Pazos) 60 946 downloads.
Making history. Tools for historical research. (Pablo Pozzi et.al) 10 725 downloads.
Open calls for research grants as well as for participation in postgraduate courses.
Input to the Latin American discussion about scientific evaluation (within FOLEC - the Latin American Forum for Scientific Evaluation).
Expansion of CLACSO communication with increased impact in social media, for example the weekly life-sent program InfoCLACSO.
